FeedItem.title: Backend and API for metering and billing processing [Java 8, stripe] - Upwork
FeedItem.description: This job is for creating a Java API to process metering and billing. The project will run on Google App Engine, you will work with Android Studio [same as IntelliJ IDEA] and we will help you set up for this scenario. We have a working framework for App Engine Endpoints, but you will write all REST endpoint and logic from scratch. Milestone 1 is about writing around 11 endpoints, which accept a request from our main system (create customer, create subscription, etc.). From the endpoint, you will feed the received data into a use case which makes one or more requests to stripe https://stripe.com/docs/api to read or write the appropriate objects. All this happens sync, and either succeeds or fails. Milestone 2 is about writing 2 or so extra endpoints which accept JSON data from our servers and processes it through a workflow (there might be queues involved, and some memcache and SQL, App Engine SDK used here). If a customer is detected as not having enough funding, you will call a hook, or alternatively, our frontend platform can query the data. Milestone 3 is for writing tests. We need full test coverage, so we can ensure all billing procedures work properly and nothing falls through the cracks. Google Cloud SDK will allow you to run their whole environment locally so you can work with simulated memcache and databases in your tests (no need for extensive mocking). You can work on this milestone parallel if you prefer test-driven environment. Milestone 4 Integrate. We may need to adjust minor things, like optimize endpoints or data formats and such. What's important is that your system must play with our remaining system. I have planned this thoroughly, so I believe it should work with minor adjustments, but we may need to work on the details a bit to get this going. We will break the project total in 4 equal parts at 25%. We expect every milestone to be completed within approximately 2 weeks. Project total around 2 months.Budget: $2,000 Posted On: September 27, 2018 13:11 UTCCategory: Web, Mobile & Software Dev > Other - Software Development Skills: API Development, Java, Stripe Country: United Statesclick to apply

FeedItem.title: Accountant / Bookkeeper Needed to Create Income/ Expense Reports for our Customers - Upwork
FeedItem.description: Introduction: Our customers in Ontario, Canada require an accounting report to be created for them. This report helps our customers apply for benefits through their insurance provider. The report summarizes the customer's previous income, their current income, and the difference between past and present income. The difference is usually a loss. This loss is used to calculate the amount of weekly benefit, which the customer may be eligible for based on Ontario, Regulation 34/10, section 7 (see https://www.ontario.ca/laws/regulation/100034) Job Deliverables: 1) Administrative support: Follow up with customers by phone and email to get the necessary information and to collect their personal, tax, and accounting documents to be used for the above accounting calculation. 2) Accounting calculation (draft): Verify supporting documentation and complete accounting calculation in an Excel template to determine customer's past and current income. Calculate income loss and corresponding weekly benefit amount. 3) Create a report (draft): Using a MS Word template, create a summary report that shows the weekly benefit amount calculation including a summary of key facts, supporting documents, and assumptions made to calculate this amount based on the regulation above as well as the unique customer's case. 4) Calculation and report (final): A certified accountant on our team will review the draft calculation and report. Some customer follow up and adjustments may be needed, after this initial review. Please create the final report / calculation with these adjustments. Skills / Requirements: - Good understanding of accounting principals - Knowledge of Canadian accounting and tax rules for individuals, businesses, and self-employed - Knowledge of how to calculate personal and self-employed income / loss - Ability to give and receive calls to/from Canadian phone numbers - Ability to work through an email account (on Gmail), which we will provide to you - Good communication skills and great follow-up skills - Fluent written and oral English - Detail oriented, especially with numbers - Customer focused Payment Structure (for each report): CAD $75 - admin follow up finished and customer documentation received CAD $125 - upon completion of the draft calculation and report CAD $200 - upon completion of the final version of the report. This is a repeating project. We expect to have 2-3 report requests per month.Budget: $325 Posted On: September 27, 2018 13:11 UTCCategory: Accounting & Consulting > Accounting Skills: Accounting, Customer Discovery, Customer Support, Financial Accounting, Microsoft Excel Country: Canadaclick to apply

FeedItem.title: Data Formatting Team Leader â€“ to lead a team of data analysts handling CRM database migrations - Upwork
FeedItem.description: Hi there, thanks for taking the time to consider our contract.   âž¢ Are you a data genius who has a proven history of successfully transforming data for CRM database migrations? âž¢ Do you have the experience and skills to lead a team of data analysts? &gt;      Do you have the technical skills to solve data formatting problems? âž¢ Are you available from 3:00am GMT (8:30am IST) daily for 30+ hours per week to work with a client based in Australia? Our business assists real estate agencies migrate from one CRM database to another and our team has now grown to the point where we need a skilled team leader to oversee and manage the various projects. WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR âž¢ You will need to have the ability to review and understand various source data tables (excel files with 100,000+ records). âž¢ You will need to develop instructions/mapping logic to transform the source data files from the client into the import templates (excel) of the destination CRM database.   âž¢ You will need to write scripts (or have a data analyst develop scripts) to efficiently process the data. âž¢ You need to be available to answer queries on the logic and provide guidance to the analysts. âž¢ You need to review the transformed data to ensure it’s mapped correctly and provide feedback to correct any errors.   âž¢ You need to review the quality of the data and provide logic / instructions to ensure that it’s cleaned up. âž¢ You need to think independently and work to find a solution to problems that may arise. âž¢ You need to have an eye for creating systems and process that are clear for others to understand and you need to thrive in providing direction and delegating tasks to the team of analysts. âž¢ You need to be available from 1pm Melbourne, Australia time (AEST). âž¢ The role will involve a combination of team leader and data analyst responsibilities (it will not be 100% team leader from the beginning but will transition as more projects come online). SKILLS REQUIRED: âž¢ Expert user of Excel (advanced formulas, VBA tools etc.), MS Access or equivalent software to create efficient solutions to handle data with minimal manual intervention âž¢ Strong attention to detail to ensure accurate and high quality work is delivered âž¢ Great communicator - responsive to the client and your team (providing timely and clear communication) âž¢ Speedy and efficient – you’re familiar with various data formats and software options to complete projects on time and meet deadlines âž¢ Logical and organised in your approach to work âž¢ A willingness and interest in working with others, being patient and encouraging of those in your team âž¢ Possess an ability to look at how you can develop the skills of others in the team âž¢ An understanding / exposure to the real estate industry would be advantageous YOUR APPLICATION If you think you’re made of the right stuff and fit with what we’re after please do the following: 1. Address your application to ‘Dear Chris’ (any generic application will be rejected). 2. Answer the screening questions. 3. Ensure your rate is within the specified range ($7-$15/hr). Please note: you must be available to work with an Australian client and you need to have immediate capacity for the work. ABOUT US We are a technology company that assists our clients (real estate agents) to choose the best CRM database for their business and help them migrate from their existing database solution to a new database solution. We are engaged by our clients to: 1) Transform the source data into the import templates of the destination CRM and 2) Format and clean-up (including managing duplicates) the source data to ensure better quality data. We are currently experiencing a growth phase and need an additional resource who is available for 30+ hours a week.  Initially the work will involve a combination of 1) reviewing the work of two analysts; and 2) scoping and developing data transformation instructions/logic, scripts and tools for future projects.   At the moment we are using a combination of MS Access and Excel but we are open to solutions if they can be demonstrated to be superior.Posted On: September 27, 2018 13:11 UTCCategory: Data Science & Analytics > Data Extraction / ETL Skills: Access VBA, Data Entry, Data Migration, Data Scraping, DataTables, "Extract, Transform and Load (ETL)", Excel VBA, Microsoft Excel, Spreadsheets Country: Australiaclick to apply

FeedItem.description: Need to offload actual coding for a very large (Access) database project.  Very simple programming, but very large datasets, and program must be carefully developed with an eye towards repeatability with dataset updates.  Our algorithm has already been largely defined.  Client will retain all work product, and all intellectual property and all communication and work notes will be proprietary.  Compensation format is negotiable (ie hours, lines, deliverables). WARNING:. This posting is to establish cost and terms for this (database) scope of work, but actual engagement will be subject to subsequent succesful negotiations with the end customer/client, and also subject to clients decisions as to in-house vs outsource coding.   Code developed will rely partially on clients underlying dataset rights and paid API licenses held directly by the client.  No data, samples, code, notes, algorithms, flow charts, methodologies or the like will be retained by the programming team under any circumstances.  If retaining copies of your work is important to you, do not apply.  If being able to talk about this specific code or the algorithm/method in future engagements or interviews is important to you, do not apply.  If you believe that extensions built partially in open APIs or code sets should also be inherently open, do not apply. We are looking for a creative lone wolf programmer, not a consultant.  Knowledge is valued over formal education.  College students  may apply, but this will be time consuming and fast-paced.  You will not need a company/LLC, business cards, business suit, logo or brand.   We don't care who/what/how you are as an individual, as long as you can act and communicate as a professional.  Three exceptions:. 1) Project/programming will incorporate data visualization schemes, so candidate should have at least some visual ability. 2) Candidate must be able to be verbally (highly) communicative.  Email alone will not suffice.  3) Preference (may) be given to candidates based on geographic proximity centered between southern Virginia and northern North Carolina.  Raleigh, Greensboro, Richmond, Charlottesville, Roanoke, Blacksburg, but more distant candidates certainly considered.  Early stage development team may be required to meet in person, but travel would be very limited.  Working hours will be extremely flexible. Corresponding flexibility will be expected of you.  Initial stage is expected to begin immediately and be completed in 90 days.  No guarantee of retention for later stages. Primary work will be centered on SQL queries, but will overlap into statistical functions, social databases, Python and/or scraping tools, and large proprietary dataset APIs.  Post engagement, the successful candidate will have documented exposure/experience (resume/references) with a significant and diverse set of large, expensive, corporate entity databases which are typically only available to those employed in investment banking or corporate development roles.  While none of the data will be retained, post engagement, the candidate will be able to reference (most) of the datasets they will by then be familiar with. Terms of employment mentioned herein are not intended to be binding.  Candidate will be expected to commit to extensive, project-specific NDA and IP and Employment Agreements, which will be binding and vigorously enforced.  You will be helping to discover and jointly create exciting new intellectual property, which you will not own, and which you will agree to be prohibited from recreating elsewhere.Posted On: September 27, 2018 13:11 UTCCategory: IT & Networking > Network & System Administration Skills: Data Scraping, Database Design, Python, Salesforce.com, SQL, Statistics, Web Scraping Location Requirement: Only freelancers located in the United States may apply. FeedItem.title: Simple Inkscape Extension - Upwork
FeedItem.description: Hi, I need a very simple Inkscape extension written.  I process large batches of images with PHP scripts through the Inkscape command line tool.  Unfortunately, the command line tool does not have all of the functionality I require.  I have read in forums that I can write an Inkscape extension and will have access to all Inkscape functionality.  This is great because I can run these extensions via the command line tool from my existing PHP scripts.  This provides an easy workaround for me. Unfortunately, I'm not a Python programmer.  I think if you know Python, you could probably research for an hour on how to complete this task, and have it completed within 2 hours.  Heck, who knows... Maybe you even have experience writing Inkscape extensions... The required extension functionality:      -select &quot;Relative to: Selection&quot; from the Align and Distribute panel           -name the extension &quot;Relative to Selection&quot;, place extension in a folder named &quot;HTA&quot; on Inkscape Extension menu.      -make a copy of this 1st extension, and make the selection &quot;Relative to: Page&quot; from the Align and Distribute panel            -name the extension &quot;Relative to Page&quot;, place extension in a folder named &quot;HTA&quot; on Inkscape Extension menu. Inkscape extension docs: https://inkscape.org/en/develop/extensions/ See the attached screenshots. Message with questions. We have the list of steps. This is for our own environment, At a very high level these are the tasks: 1. Restore the Client database to a server with Pre-installed CRM 2011 2. Run a sql script to clean the db 3. Import the Organization 4. Back up the DB 5. Run another SQL script 6. Back up the CRM 2013 upgraded DB 7. Restore to another server with CRM 2015 installed already 8. Import Org 9. Run a script 10. Back up the db 11. Restore to another CRM 2016 already installed 12. Import Org Run another SQL script. Done. When we do this on client servers, there are some variations. For every new installation or deployment of software, we have to do many system checks and verifications on their Windows Servers Lets define the scope of work. Do the low hanging fruits first. Lets make it a phased approach. Automation of these frequently repetitive tasks with every client will save us a lot of time in deployments and will make us more productive. FeedItem.title: Civil Maps is Hiring for freelance consultant - DevOps Engineer - Upwork
FeedItem.description: Hi , We are Civil Maps . Civil Maps, provider of 3D mapping technology for fully autonomous vehicles, has raised a $6.6 million seed funding round from Ford Motor Company, Motus Ventures, Wicklow Capital, StartX Stanford and Yahoo cofounder Jerry Yang’s AME Cloud Ventures. Civil Maps’ mission is to make it possible for fully autonomous vehicles (SAE Levels 4-5) to drive anywhere smoothly and safely. Through artificial intelligence and vehicle-based local processing, Civil Maps converts sensor data into meaningful map information built specifically to direct fully autonomous vehicles. The company will use the seed investment to accelerate product development and deployment with a number of leading automotive companies and technology partners. Civil Maps’ artificial intelligence software aggregates raw 3D data from LiDAR (high-resolution laser imaging), camera and other sensors onboard autonomous vehicles and organizes the information into machine-readable maps. The information is vastly more actionable information than today’s mapping systems and requires a fraction of the data storage and transmission for existing technologies. Thanks to this light data footprint, Civil Maps’ spatial information is far less costly to transmit over cellular networks, enabling the company to more easily crowdsource, update and share road data in real time—a major improvement over the lengthy processes that require human annotation in current use. As a result, the company can quickly generate and maintain maps that give fully autonomous vehicles the comprehensive and precise knowledge to autonomous operate safely and smoothly on all roads. About the Opportunity : This is an opportunity to work on some of the most exciting problems in the autonomous vehicle industry. Civil Maps is looking for a Devops engineer to grow its overall infrastructure. You will be interacting with a completely custom-made distributed computing framework, handling terabytes and petabytes of machine vision data, and millions of requests from robotic platforms. In our interdisciplinary teams, you will get acquainted with the many facets of 3D map creation: data collection, geospatial registration, feature extraction, auditing. Come work on novel challenges, learn and grow while helping Civil Maps achieve on-demand perception of the world around us. We are hiring the professionals for the below skills: Work Location  : Hyderabad Job Description for DevOps Enginner: Experience : 3-15 yrs Responsibilities : Deliver next generation distributed applications using a variety of tools to include Kubernetes, Ansible, RHEL, Openshift, Atomic, Mesos, Openstack and Docker. Build solutions and provide a framework for Microservices and DevOps. Bring knowledge and help with continuous integration, deployment and security. Automating the Build &amp; Deployment environment with relative tools. Troubleshooting Build &amp; Deployment issues. Experience with the following : Deploy, manage Continuous Integration tools (Jenkins, Travis etc..). Cloud-based deployments (AWS, Azure, OpenStack). Linux administration, usage, and bash scripting (Bash, Batch, Powershell) Deploying MEAN stack applications. Security tools like Fortify, Nessus. Network architecture (routing, load balancing, firewalls, VLANs). Virtualization (VMWare, XEN, KVM, Openstack). Container technologies (Mesos, Docker, Rocket, etc.). Experience in setting up backup and restore mechanism for the DB and other relevant systems.Posted On: September 27, 2018 13:11 UTCCategory: IT & Networking > Network & System Administration Country: Indiaclick to apply
